text.0: At today’s resumed #WHA73 - @DrTedros called for predictable sustainable WHO funding and stressed the need to “reimagine” global leadership reflecting the lessons of the #COVID19 pandemic https://t.co/GpqkrM3Uil
text.1:
To nurses and midwives of the :globe_showing_Europe-Africa::

:red_heart: Thank you for working round the clock to fight the #COVID19 pandemic.

:red_heart: Thank you for the difference you are making, every day and everywhere.

#WHA73 #SupportNursesAndMidwives https://t.co/z3eI9GE7VP
text.2: The purpose of the Universal Health & Preparedness Review is to build mutual trust & accountability by bringing nations together for a regular & transparent review of capacities. Thanks to the Central African Republic :Central_African_Republic: and Benin :Benin: for the idea! #WHA73
text.3: Today I proposed the Universal Health & Preparedness Review, a new system of peer review for emergency preparedness, #HealthForAll & healthier populations. I invited countries to join Cameroon :Cameroon:, the Central African Republic :Central_African_Republic:, France :France: & Germany :Germany: in the pilot phase. #WHA73
text.4:
#HealthWorkers, you can help women survivors of violence during #COVID19 
:handshake: Offer first-line support to women
:adhesive_bandage:  Provide medical treatment
:red_heart_selector: Connect and refer to survivors to support https://t.co/TyQaMSdtIs
text.5:
Pleased to give #Tonga Health Minister Amelia Afuha’amango Tu’ipulotu & :Tonga: Nurse Choir the @WHO Director-General Award - they lifted our spirits & touched our hearts with today's performance at #WHA73, to mark the Year of the Nurse & the Midwife.
https://t.co/Z8VF3zIkqG
text.6:
During the #COVID19 pandemic, risks of violence increase due to:
:exclamation_mark: More time at home with abusers
:exclamation_mark: Rising stress
:exclamation_mark: Isolation from social support networks
:exclamation_mark: Limited access to critical services https://t.co/q562ppdCbO
text.7: "A lot of what we do doesn’t make headlines. It’s not photogenic. But it makes a vital difference to the lives of billions of people," - @DrTedros, in his opening remarks at #WHA73 this morning. Soundbytes for broadcasters here: https://t.co/rkzsYJtZOI
text.8:
If you are experiencing violence at home during #COVID19 and need to leave in a hurry:

:houses_selector: Identify a friend, neighbour, relative or shelter you can go to
:shuffle_tracks_button: Plan how to get there
:school_backpack: Keep ready essential personal items to take with you https://t.co/LLY6o4Mb1Y
text.9:
If you are experiencing violence during #COVID19:
:handshake: Reach out to supportive family, friends or neighbours
:telephone_receiver: Call a hotline or access information online if possible
:SOS_button: Seek out local services for survivors

https://t.co/EYsQY8Xrq2 https://t.co/ZzNfvv3ryd
text.10:
"During my visit to #Syria, I met doctors, nurses & other health staff who had braved years of working under threat of attack, and yet stayed behind to save lives despite limited resources."

More on @WHOEMRO Regional Director's mission to Syria :right_arrow_selector: https://t.co/Aw9oZuFgp8 https://t.co/Yo7tBRz6uA
text.11:
Day 1 #WHA73 is adjourned. 
We will continue tomorrow, 10h00 CET.

Thank you for following - see you tomorrow.

https://t.co/R0Ju6Fvb90
text.12:
Mamadou Henri Konate from #Mali:Mali: has been appointed Chairperson of Committee B at the 73rd World Health Assembly #WHA73.

:play_button_selector: https://t.co/R0Ju6Fvb90
text.13:
Honoured to give Her Royal Highness Princess Muna Al-Hussein of #Jordan @WHO Director-General’s Health Leaders Award for her dedication and service to health and humanity, and her tireless #SupportNursesAndMidwives over six decades. #WHA73

:camera: Feb 2018 https://t.co/K5ASdJx5Tf https://t.co/BsveBlBYX8
text.14: We welcome the encouraging vaccine news from @pfizer & @BioNTech_Group & salute all scientists & partners around the :globe_showing_Europe-Africa: who are developing new safe, efficacious tools to beat #COVID19. The :globe_showing_Europe-Africa: is experiencing unprecedented scientific innovation & collaboration to end the pandemic!
text.15:
LIVE: Follow #WHA73 Committee B discussions on our website
:play_button_selector: https://t.co/R0Ju6Fvb90
text.16:
Dr Bjørn-Inge Larsen from #Norway:Norway: has been appointed Chairperson of Committee A at the 73rd World Health Assembly #WHA73.

:play_button_selector: https://t.co/R0Ju6Fvb90 https://t.co/xYn3LYR5Ub
text.17:
It’s time to forge a new era of cooperation, that puts health and well-being at the centre of our common future.

The rules of the game are:
-cooperation
-solidarity
-compassion
-peace.

We’re one big family. #WHA73
text.18:
There is no vaccine for poverty, hunger, climate change or inequality.

It’s time for the world to heal – from the ravages of the #COVID19 pandemic, and the geopolitical divisions that only drive us further into the chasm of an unhealthier, un-safer and unfairer future. #WHA73
text.19:
LIVE: Follow #WHA73 Committee A discussions here :down_arrow_selector: or on our website :play_button_selector: https://t.co/R0Ju6Fvb90
https://t.co/5FL2BoNPny
text.21:
Today, I called on @WHO Member States to reimagine:
:keycap_digit_one: leadership, built on mutual trust & accountability
:keycap_digit_two:investments, by allocating & aligning resources with our shared priorities
:keycap_digit_three:partnership, by tearing down our siloes & connecting our efforts into something bigger
#WHA73 https://t.co/BS7Asj8uVZ
text.22: The full opening address by @DrTedros at the resumed #WHA73 :backhand_index_pointing_down: https://t.co/DriOz7pyW9
text.23:
"We must see it for what it is: a fundamental human right that underpins every human aspiration. 

Today and every day, we must choose health. We’re one big family.

The rule of the game is cooperation, solidarity, compassion, peace"-@DrTedros #WHA73 #WeAreFamily
text.24:
"We cannot afford ever-deepening inequalities and expect continued peace and prosperity. We must choose.

And we cannot afford to see health merely as a by-product of development, or a commodity that only the rich can afford"-@DrTedros #WHA73
text.25: "We cannot afford to pump carbon dioxide into the atmosphere at the same rate and still breathe clean air. We must choose"-@DrTedros #WHA73
text.26:
"It’s time to forge a new era of cooperation, that puts health and well-being at the centre of our common future. 

The world has reached a fork in the road"-@DrTedros #WHA73
text.27: "It’s time for the world to heal – from the ravages of the #COVID19 pandemic, and the geopolitical divisions that only drive us further into the chasm of an unhealthier, un-safer and unfairer future"-@DrTedros #WHA73
text.28:
"We need to reimagine investments in our shared future, by allocating and aligning resources with our shared priorities.

And we need to reimagine partnership, tear down our siloes and see our own efforts as connected to something bigger"-@DrTedros #WHA73
text.29: "We need to reimagine leadership, built on mutual trust and mutual accountability – to end the #COVID19 pandemic and address the fundamental inequalities that lie at the root of so many of the world’s problems"-@DrTedros #WHA73
text.30: "In that spirit, we congratulate President Elect Joe Biden and Vice President-Elect Kamala Harris and we look forward to working with their administration very closely"-@DrTedros #WHA73
text.31: "However, we must be honest: we can only realise the full power and potential of the @GlobalGoalsUN if the international community urgently recaptures the sense of common purpose that gave birth to them"-@DrTedros #WHA73
text.32: "But far from abandoning them, the #COVID19 pandemic has shown why the @GlobalGoalsUN, with their sweeping vision for people, planet, prosperity, peace and partnership, are so important, and must remain our guide now and in the post-COVID world"-@DrTedros #WHA73
text.33: "We were already off-track to achieve the @GlobalGoalsUN  before the #COVID19 pandemic. Now we are even further behind"-@DrTedros #WHA73
text.35: "Since then, the creeping tides of misguided nationalism and isolationism have eroded that sense of common purpose"-@DrTedros #WHA73
text.36:
"In 2015, the :globe_showing_Europe-Africa: came together to adopt the @GlobalGoalsUN, the Paris Agreement & the Addis Ababa Action Agenda on finance for development.

It was a moment of great convergence; the nations of the :globe_showing_Europe-Africa: uniting for a common purpose & a common future"-@DrTedros #WHA73
text.37:
"There is no vaccine for poverty, hunger, #climatechange or inequality.

None of these challenges can be addressed in isolation. They are deeply intertwined – and so must be our response"-@DrTedros #WHA73
text.38: "A vaccine cannot address the global under-investment in essential public health functions and resilient health systems, nor the urgent need for a “One Health” approach that encompasses the health of humans, animals and the planet we share"-@DrTedros #WHA73
text.39: "A vaccine is needed urgently to control the #COVID19 pandemic. But as you know, it will not fix the vulnerabilities at its roots"-@DrTedros #ACTogether #WHA73
text.40:
:loudspeaker: #WHA73 will resume at 14h00 CET.

You can follow the discussions as follow: 
:black_small_square_selector: Plenary meeting on our website
:black_small_square_selector: Committee A via Twitter or website
:black_small_square_selector: Committee B on our website

:play_button_selector: https://t.co/R0Ju6Fvb90 https://t.co/dqezccXQH7
text.41:
"...Or will they say that #COVID19 was a turning point for global health security, and for global health? 

This is our opportunity to write that story now"-@DrTedros #WHA73
text.42:
"This will not be the last global health crisis. When the next one arrives, will the headlines be the same? 

Will they say that after the #COVID19 pandemic, the world wrung its hands, wrote reports and changed nothing?
..."-@DrTedros #WHA73
text.43: "We welcome any other Member State interested in participating in this pilot phase, and we look forward to discussing this idea further with Member States in the coming weeks and months"-@DrTedros #WHA73
text.44: "Since I mentioned the concept in my address to this Assembly in May, :Cameroon:, the :Central_African_Republic:, :France: and :Germany: have expressed interest in the idea, and have agreed to work with the Secretariat in the start-up phase to develop and pilot the mechanism"-@DrTedros #WHA73
text.45:
The response to #COVID19 has shown that rapid change is both necessary and possible for @WHO.
But @WHO was already changing well before the pandemic struck. https://t.co/SBoR2nsQ9d #WHA73
text.46: "We are now in the process of developing a more detailed proposal, which we will share with Member States very shortly"-@DrTedros #WHA73
text.47: "Its purpose is to build mutual trust & accountability for health, by bringing nations together as neighbours to support a whole-of-govt approach to strengthening national capacities for pandemic preparedness, universal health coverage & healthier populations"-@DrTedros #WHA73
text.48:
"We’re calling it the Universal Health and Preparedness Review"-@DrTedros #WHA73 

https://t.co/CeukQvarqE
text.49: "One idea proposed last year by the :Central_African_Republic: & :Benin: as the then-Chair of the @_AfricanUnion is a system in which countries agree to a regular and transparent process of peer review, similar to the system of universal periodic review used by the Human Rights Council"-@DrTedros #WHA73
text.50: "Any discussion about strengthening WHO cannot focus only on the Secretariat. It must include the entire fabric of the organization, beginning with stronger national capacities and improved international cooperation, as Princess Muna said earlier"-@DrTedros #WHA73
text.51: "As you know, @TheIndPanel for Pandemic Preparedness and Response, the IHR Review Committee and the Independent Oversight and Advisory Committee for the WHO Health Emergencies Programme are all progressing, and you will be hearing updates from them all at this #WHA73"-@DrTedros
text.52:
"We still have a lot of work left to do, but we believe that we’re on the right track.

Together, we need to accelerate the implementation of transformation, even as we continue to learn and add new ideas.

For us, change is a constant"-@DrTedros #WHA73
text.53:
"We have already achieved an incredible amount. 

Despite the challenges of the pandemic, many aspects of WHO’s Transformation Agenda are already coming to life, & have been crucial in enabling us to respond to #COVID19 while sustaining our core programmes"-@DrTedros #WHA73
text.54:
"We’ve improved conditions and opportunities for interns, national professional officers and G-staff. 

And we’ve reduced the time it takes to recruit staff by 20% and we aim to reduce it by half"-@DrTedros #WHA73
text.55:
":keycap_digit_seven: building a motivated, diverse & fit-for-purpose workforce.

We achieved gender parity in senior leadership for the first time in WHO, & we’re making progress in other areas"-@DrTedros #WHA73
text.56: "We’re also grateful to those Member States that have supported WHO with increased funding, and with increased flexibility and predictability"-@DrTedros #WHA73
text.57: "We welcome the recommendation that these issues need addressing urgently, and we thank France :France:, Germany :Germany:and the European Union :European_Union: for their initiative in addressing this issue"-@DrTedros #WHA73
text.58: "As the report of the Programme, Budget and Administration Committee before this Assembly highlights, there is a major misalignment between the expectations Member States have of WHO and the funding that we receive"-@DrTedros #WHA73
text.59:
"Our annual budget is equivalent to what the :globe_showing_Europe-Africa: spends on :cigarette: products every single day
If the :globe_showing_Europe-Africa: can send that much :money_bag: up in smoke every day on products that maim & kill, surely it can find the :money_bag: & the political will to invest in promoting & protecting people's health"-@DrTedros
text.60: "In the past decade, the world’s expectations of WHO have grown dramatically, but our budget has barely changed. And those expectations will only continue to increase in the wake of the #COVID19 pandemic"-@DrTedros #WHA73
text.61:
"Predictable & sustainable funding remains 1 of the fundamental challenges for the future success of this Organization.
For WHO to do its job, we must address the shocking & expanding imbalance between assessed contributions & voluntary, largely earmarked funds"-@DrTedros #WHA73
text.62: "As part of that, the innovative Solidarity Response Fund raised almost $240 million from almost 650,000 individuals, companies & philanthropies, providing powerful proof of concept for the potential of the new @thewhof, which we established recently"-@DrTedros #WHA73
text.63: "This year also saw a generous and unprecedented response to our #COVID19 Strategic Preparedness and Response Plan – with $1.6 billion raised so far"-@DrTedros #WHA73
text.64:
"Building on our first Partners Forum in Sweden, we are now in a constructive dialogue with many donors based on our new resource mobilization strategy, approved by the Executive Board earlier this year"-@DrTedros #WHOImpact #WHA73 

https://t.co/QSw6JgnswW
text.65:
"To do that, we launched our first investment case, and we expect to release an updated version in the first quarter of next year"-@DrTedros #WHOImpact #WHA73

https://t.co/oMhmpMqfXI
text.66:
":keycap_digit_six: ensuring predictable and sustainable funding.

We recognised that WHO was too dependent on a handful of large donors, and that we needed to broaden the donor base"-@DrTedros #WHA73
text.67:
"The result was our first values charter, which outlines five values that make us who we are:
:white_heavy_check_mark: service
:white_heavy_check_mark: excellence
:white_heavy_check_mark: integrity
:white_heavy_check_mark: collaboration
:white_heavy_check_mark: compassion.

We will be relentless in holding ourselves to these values, wherever we operate"-@DrTedros #WHA73
text.68: "Two years ago, more than 2700 staff engaged in our online values jam, to identify the values that define WHO and anchor our day-to-day work"-@DrTedros #WHA73
text.69:
":keycap_digit_five: a new culture that is focused on results.

The culture of any organization – its values and mindset – lies at the heart of its ability to succeed. But a positive, unifying culture doesn’t happen by accident. It must be shaped"-@DrTedros #WHA73
text.70: "The Global Action Plan on Health and Well-Being for All is progressing, bringing together 12 multilateral agencies to support countries to accelerate towards the @GlobalGoalsUN"-@DrTedros #WHA73
text.71: "We've engaged regularly with the private sector through the :globe_showing_Europe-Africa:’s business associations & innovative partnerships with @Facebook, @Twitter, @Google & others have helped to counter misinformation about #COVID19 & brought reliable info to 2B+ people in 50+ languages"-@DrTedros
text.72: "We have entered new partnerships with @FIFAcom, @Google Fit and the International @Olympics Committee to promote physical activity"-@DrTedros #BeActive #WHA73
text.73:
":keycap_digit_four:a new approach to partnerships.

In the past, WHO has been too focused on the risks of partnership, and not on the opportunities. But we must also see the risks of not engaging in new partnerships that could help us achieve our goals"-@DrTedros #WHA73
text.74: "We’ve developed three-level delivery teams, involving staff at headquarters, regional and country offices to work together more closely on delivering the outputs and outcomes of the #GPW13, based on country priorities"-@DrTedros #WHA73
text.75: "We have flattened our structures to reduce the layers of hierarchy & make us more agile & nimble"-@DrTedros #WHA73
text.76: ":keycap_digit_three:, a new aligned operating model, which for the first time clearly differentiates the role of headquarters, regional and country offices, and aligns our structures at all three levels, is enabling us to work more seamlessly to deliver results"-@DrTedros #WHA73
text.77: "Based on the #GPW13, more than 300 global public health goods have now been defined, giving Member States the technical and normative tools you need to meet your biggest health challenges"-@DrTedros #WHA73
text.78:
":keycap_digit_two:, new processes to make us more effective and efficient.
Our new Science Division established a fast-track review mechanism to ensure the timeliness, coherence & quality of all WHO guidance, beginning with #COVID19, providing approval or critique within 48h"-@DrTedros #WHA73
text.79: "We’ve established a new Department of Digital Health and Innovation, and developed a Global Digital Health Strategy, which is also on your agenda this week"-@DrTedros #WHA73
text.80: "Our impact measurement framework was piloted in 34 countries, and is before you for consideration at this Assembly. Today we are also launching a “triple billion” dashboard to track progress towards the health-related @GlobalGoalsUN"-@DrTedros #WHA73
text.81: "Our new division for Data, Analytics and Delivery for Impact is making WHO a modern, data-driven organization that supports Member States with timely, reliable and actionable data to drive impact"-@DrTedros #WHA73
text.82: "All 150 country offices have now developed their own plans to support and implement the General Programme of Work, and as part of our transformation of performance management, every single staff member has now linked their day-to-day work to the #GPW13"-@DrTedros #WHA73
text.83:
":keycap_digit_one: a new strategy focused on delivering impact.

Two years ago, this Assembly approved the most ambitious strategic plan in WHO’s history, designed to help you, our Member States, deliver a measurable impact in your countries"-@DrTedros #WHA73
text.84: "We have prepared a detailed transformation update, which Member States will receive during the Assembly. But allow me to point out a few highlights"-@DrTedros #WHA73 :down_arrow_selector:
text.85:
"Rest assured that we want change too, which is why for the past 3,5 years, together with you our Member States, we have designed and implemented the most deep-rooted transformation in WHO’s history.

This is an organization that has changed and is changing"-@DrTedros #WHA73
text.86:
"In recent months, there have been calls for WHO to be reformed.
We welcome any & all efforts to strengthen this organization – not for its own sake, but for the sake of the people we serve. We are committed to continuous learning, improvement, & accountability"-@DrTedros #WHA73
text.87:
"A lot of what we do doesn’t make headlines. It’s not photogenic. But it makes a vital difference to the lives of billions of people"-@DrTedros #WHA73 

https://t.co/HTa1oqBeQ8
text.88:
"It’s a long list – and it doesn’t even scratch the surface. 

Every day, our 8000 staff all over the world are working in ways most people never see to promote health, keep the world safe, and serve the vulnerable"-@DrTedros #WHA73 

https://t.co/n739VYQMuI
text.89:
":Singapore: is a great example. Following WHO’s call for Member States to eliminate trans fats by 2023, :Singapore: has announced a ban to be introduced next year, making it the first country in the @WHOWPRO to eliminate trans fats from its food supply"-@DrTedros #WHA73

https://t.co/7C1MpjBm87
text.90:
"40 countries have now adopted best-practice policies on the elimination of trans fats, improving the health of up to 280 million people"-@DrTedros #BeatNCDs #WHA73 

https://t.co/14Vkxkdn3F
text.91:
"We’ve developed a proposal for a Decade of Healthy Ageing from 2020 to 2030, which has been endorsed by this Assembly and will now be considered by @UN Member States"-@DrTedros #WHA73 

https://t.co/RXVk8PcADg
text.92:
"Today, WHO & the @UNFCCC are hosting the “Race to Zero dialogue”, to envision how a healthy, equitable recovery from #COVID19 can make us more resilient against future health threats & drive the rapid decarbonization of the :globe_showing_Europe-Africa: economy"-@DrTedros #WHA73 
https://t.co/vNUloqm78L
text.93:
"We published our “Manifesto for a Healthy & Green Recovery”, with more than 80 policy prescriptions for protecting natural resources, investing in water & sanitation, renewable energy, healthy food systems, & liveable cities"-@DrTedros #WHA73 

https://t.co/VWErykRxAr
text.94: ":keycap_digit_three:work has also progressed on our target to see 1 billion more people enjoying better health and well-being"-@DrTedros #WHA73 :down_arrow_selector:
text.95:
"But thanks to the surveillance system put in place, the outbreak was detected and stopped"-@DrTedros #WHA73 

https://t.co/ZToVIVZJv4
text.96: "In 2018 WHO supported :Laos: to establish a national surveillance system for #AntimicrobialResistance. Earlier this year, an outbreak of antibiotic-resistant outbreak Klebisella pneumoniae in an intensive care neonatal unit tragically killed 8 newborns"-@DrTedros #WHA73
text.97: "More than 90 countries have enrolled in GLASS, the Global #AntimicrobialResistance Surveillance System, and WHO has supported 138 countries to establish national action plans on AMR"-@DrTedros #WHA73
text.98: "Together with the @FAO and the @OIEAnimalHealth, we are also continuing to coordinate the global response to #antimicrobialresistance"-@DrTedros #WHA73
text.99:
"We continue to rid the :globe_showing_Europe-Africa: of neglected tropical diseases:
-The people of :Malawi: need no longer fear lymphatic filariasis
-The people of :Togo: have been freed of African trypanosomiasis
-Endemic rubella has been eliminated in :Sri_Lanka:
-Trachoma is no more in :Myanmar_(Burma):"-@DrTedros #HealthForAll #WHA73
text.100:
"You have also adopted the Global Strategy to Accelerate the Elimination #CervicalCancer as a Public Health Problem – the first time the global health community has committed to eliminating a cancer"-@DrTedros #BeatNCDs #WHA73 

https://t.co/ckaSg1kuqr
text.101:
"We’ve rolled out new guidelines for the diagnosis, prevention and treatment of #tuberculosis, and developed the Global Strategy on TB Research and Innovation, which was adopted by this Assembly"-@DrTedros #EndTB #WHA73 

https://t.co/bLxqOmB0mF
text.102:
"We’ve supported countries to maintain treatment for #HIV, provided emergency antiretrovirals for countries at risk of disruptions, and published new guidelines on voluntary medical male circumcision"-@DrTedros #HealthForAll #WHA73 

https://t.co/Z5qPaNlHj3
text.103:
"We’re on track to achieve the @GlobalGoalsUN target on #hepatitisB prevalence in children under 5, and will soon complete development of the criteria for validating elimination of viral hepatitis"-@DrTedros #HealthForAll #WHA73 

https://t.co/0TMfQrCLeA
text.104:
"More than 480,000 children in :Ghana:, :Kenya: and :Malawi: have received their first dose of the world’s first #malaria vaccine"-@DrTedros #EndMalaria #WHA73 

https://t.co/BnJA7Q26Yo
text.105:
"On communicable diseases, there is cause for optimism. 

In the Greater Mekong, cases & deaths from #malaria are falling & the threat of antimalarial resistance spreading around the world has eased"-@DrTedros #EndMalaria #WHA73
text.106: "In :Honduras:, WHO & @pahowho have supported the govt. to develop a national plan for diabetes, including improving data on diabetes, strengthening dialysis registries & distributing glucometers to primary care clinics for point-of-care glycaemic control"-@DrTedros #BeatNCDs #WHA73
text.107: "Together with the @ITU, we launched a new global standard for #safelistening on personal audio systems, which has been implemented by several companies including two leading smartphone manufacturers, @Apple & @Huawei"-@DrTedros #WHA73
text.108:
"On noncommunicable diseases, there is also progress.

More than 3 million people in 18 countries are now receiving treatment for #hypertension as a result of implementing WHO’s HEARTS package of interventions for cardiovascular disease"-@DrTedros #BeatNCDs #WHA73
text.109:
"#Breastfeeding rates continue to increase. More than 44% of babies under 6 months are now exclusively breastfed, up from 37% in 2012.
That’s 10M more babies getting the best possible start to life, & a lower risk of disease later in life"-@DrTedros #HealthForAll #WHA73 https://t.co/bdoqe6rPX1
text.110:
"We led a huge international trial to show that in addition to its benefits in treating severe #COVID19, #dexamethasone can also boost survival of premature babies when given to pregnant women at risk of preterm birth"-@DrTedros #HealthForAll #WHA73
https://t.co/dlyG7X8zMV
text.111: "On sexual and reproductive health, we’ve scaled up the use of evidence-based family planning interventions using a peer-to-peer approach, where countries in similar contexts share best practices and lessons learned"-@DrTedros #HealthForAll #WHA73
text.112:
"On maternal & child health, we’ve published new standards for improving the quality of care for small & sick newborns & provided intensive support for 20 countries to address the indirect impact of #COVID19 on mothers & children"-@DrTedros #HealthForAll 
https://t.co/X25apqRAm9
text.113:
"We’ve drawn new & much-needed attention to #mentalhealth, with new guidelines on stress management & adolescent & mental health, & we hosted the Big Event for Mental Health, a global advocacy event seen by more than 600,000 people"-@DrTedros #WHA73 

https://t.co/wzNE5hQHqU
text.114:
"We published the first global report on the burden of #sepsis, and a charter on health worker safety"-@DrTedros #HealthForAll #WHA73 

https://t.co/z8dzRWNtF1
text.115:
"We launched the WHO Listed Authorities initiative, to assess and recognize national regulatory authorities, and speed up the approval of and access to vaccines, diagnostics and therapeutics.

We prequalified the world’s first vaccines for Ebola and malaria"-@DrTedros #WHA73
text.116:
"As part of the Intl. Year of the Nurse & the Midwife, we published the 1st State of the World’s Nursing Report, showing the :globe_showing_Europe-Africa: is facing a global shortfall of 5.9M nurses"-@DrTedros #WHA73 #SupportNursesAndMidwives 

https://t.co/R5pOnjZanJ
text.117: "In response, we’ve supported immunization services in Africa, respiratory triage centres in the Middle East, primary care in Europe and much, much more"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #HealthForAll #WHA73
text.118: "In a WHO survey of 105 countries in August, almost all reported disruption to 25 essential health services, incl. outpatient care, diagnosis & treatment for communicable & to #BeatNCDS, family planning, mental health conditions & more"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #HealthForAll #WHA73
text.119: "Much of our work this year has been directed at supporting Member States to maintain essential health services, which have been severely disrupted in many countries as a result of the #COVID19 pandemic"-@DrTedros #HealthForAll #WHA73
text.120: ":keycap_digit_two:, there has been progress towards our target to see 1 billion more people benefiting from universal health coverage"-@DrTedros #HealthForAll #WHA73 :down_arrow_selector:
text.121:
"And the Global Preparedness Monitoring Board has issued its second report, which lays out the lessons the world must learn and the concrete actions we can and must take to keep the world safe"-@DrTedros #AWorldInDisorder #WHA73 

https://t.co/cRCZPOekn8
text.122: "We remain fully focused both on the final eradication of #polio, and on the transition from the polio programme in countries, to ensure the significant investments made in the polio response continue to deliver a return in stronger health systems"-@DrTedros #EndPolio #WHA73
text.123: "Although the #COVID19 pandemic disrupted #polio vaccination campaigns in Pakistan and Afghanistan, we have now restarted them"-@DrTedros #EndPolio #WHA73
text.124:
"There have been successes and setbacks in our efforts to rid the world of #polio. 

Type 3 polio has been eradicated, and the African region has been declared free of wild poliovirus"-@DrTedros #EndPolio #WHA73 

https://t.co/OHA5sVhvKM
text.125: "And we’re working to leverage existing partnerships to build a global health emergency workforce to expand, train and standardize high-quality public health and medical assistance to Member States"-@DrTedros #WHA73
text.126:
"We provided urgent support to thousands of refugees and migrants in #Greece after the fire at the asylum centre on Lesvos"-@DrTedros #WHA73 

https://t.co/TppYWfgwYe
text.127: "Following the devastating blast in #Beirut in August, WHO and our partners provided care for the injured, mental health support for #healthworkers and communities, and helped to rebuild destroyed hospitals"-@DrTedros #WHA73 https://t.co/nxKaG9rapi
text.128: "And we’re now counting down to the end of the #Ebola outbreak in western #DRC"-@DrTedros #WHA73
text.129:
"...– one of the most complex health emergencies WHO has ever faced, made even more difficult by the :globe_showing_Europe-Africa:’s largest #measles outbreak"-@DrTedros #Ebola #DRC #WHA73 

https://t.co/jziithekkG
text.130:
"After an 18-month struggle, under the leadership of the #DRC government and with multiple partners, we ended the #Ebola outbreak in the country’s east..."-@DrTedros #WHA73 

https://t.co/jziithekkG
text.131: "It hasn’t made the headlines, but so far this year we have responded to 60+ emergencies, incl. major outbreaks of Chikungunya in :Chad:, yellow fever in :Gabon: & :Togo:, measles in :Mexico:, conflicts in the Sahel, Middle East & Caucasus, storms in the :Philippines: and :Vietnam:, & much more"-@DrTedros #WHA73
text.132: ":keycap_digit_one:, in our commitment to make 1 billion people safer from health emergencies, #COVID19 is far from the only emergency to which WHO has responded"-@DrTedros #WHA73
text.133: "Although WHO has been fully focused on coordinating and supporting the response to the #COVID19 pandemic globally, regionally and nationally, we have continued to implement much of our existing workplans on each of WHO’s “triple billion” targets"-@DrTedros #WHA73
text.134: "The #COVID19 pandemic has highlighted that healthier populations, universal health coverage and global health security are deeply intertwined"-@DrTedros #WHA73 https://t.co/F3JjUteN5q
text.135:
"That’s why WHO was proud to join #CostaRica in May to launch C-TAP, the #COVID19 Technology Access Pool, and it’s why we welcome :India: and :South_Africa:’s submission to the @wto to waive certain provisions of the TRIPS Agreement during the pandemic"-@DrTedros #WHA73 

https://t.co/9m56Q0cnVE
text.136: "The world has come together as never before to ensure these life-saving tools are developed, produced and allocated fairly as global public goods, not private commodities that become one more reason some people are left behind"-@DrTedros #ACTogether #WHA73
text.137:
"And together with our partners @gavi and @CEPIvaccines, COVAX is supporting the development of 9 #COVID19 vaccines, with more in the pipeline.

186 countries and economies are now participating in the COVAX facility"-@DrTedros #ACTogether #WHA73
text.138: "We’ve secured courses of #dexamethasone – the only medicine shown to reduce the risk of death so far – for up to 4.5 million #COVID19 patients in lower-income countries"-@DrTedros #ACTogether #WHA73
text.139:
"And it’s delivering real results. 

In September we reached an agreement to make 120 million new rapid #COVID19 tests available to low- and middle-income countries"-@DrTedros #ACTogether #WHA73 

https://t.co/GKCqec9mdt
text.140:
"Even as we use the tools we have to suppress transmission & save lives, we know we need better tools to bring #COVID19 under control. The ACT-Accelerator is a unique mechanism with 2 aims:
-to develop vaccines, diagnostics & therapeutics fast
-to allocate them fairly"-@DrTedros
text.141:
"And we have worked day and night to foster solidarity.

When the history of the #COVID19 pandemic is written, I believe that the ACT-Accelerator will be recorded as one of its standout successes"-@DrTedros #ACTogether #WHA73 

https://t.co/GYSyIOP7hy
text.142: "The https://t.co/RjHSBkVjlH learning platform has provided free online training in 17 different topics, in 41 languages, with more than 4.5 million user registrations from all over the world, providing powerful proof-of-concept for the WHO Academy"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #WHA73
text.143:
"We’ve delivered almost 13,000 oxygen concentrators to 110 countries, and in several countries we’re designing and building oxygen generation plants"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #WHA73 

https://t.co/SJYNfJWkyO
text.144: "We’ve given countries the solutions they need by sending more than 285 million essential medical products to 168 countries and territories, including masks, gloves, gowns, goggles, swabs, tests and more"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #WHA73
text.145:
"Through the Solidarity Trial, we’ve run one of the largest and most diverse clinical trials, to generate robust data on therapeutics"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #WHA73 

https://t.co/QR7PKWVDnA
text.146:
"More than 600 draft guidance documents have been produced, with up to 9 million downloads per month"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #WHA73 

https://t.co/JVtJ8YM0FD
text.147:
"That is what WHO has been doing since the beginning. 

We’ve advanced science by bringing together thousands of experts to analyse the ever-evolving evidence and distil it into guidance, and identify a research roadmap to fill the gaps in our knowledge"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #WHA73
text.148:
"We cannot negotiate with #COVID19, nor close our eyes and hope it goes away.

It pays no heed to political rhetoric or conspiracy theories. 

Our only hope is science, solutions and solidarity"-@DrTedros #WHA73 

https://t.co/yvdDa85hNz
text.149:
"We might be tired of #COVID19. But it is not tired of us.

Yes, it preys on those in weaker health. But it preys on other weaknesses, too: inequality, division, denial, wishful thinking and wilful ignorance"-@DrTedros #WHA73
text.150: "Nevertheless, several countries, especially in Europe and the Americas, have now re-introduced restrictions to address the new wave of #COVID19 infections they are facing, and prevent their health systems from being overwhelmed"-@DrTedros #WHA73
text.151:
"There are many countries and cities that have successfully prevented or controlled #COVID19 transmission with a comprehensive, evidence-based approach"-@DrTedros #WHA73 

https://t.co/vw1JG2j2W1
text.152:
"Although this is a global crisis, we must remember that countries have responded differently, and they have been affected differently. 

Half of all #COVID19 cases and deaths are in just four countries"-@DrTedros #WHA73
text.153: "No one knows the long-term effects of this virus on the human body, or on the type of world our children and grandchildren will inherit"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #WHA73
text.154:
"But the #COVID19 pandemic has also taken a toll in ways that no one can measure.

We can’t measure the grief of families who weren’t able to say goodbye to their loved ones.

We can’t measure the fear felt by so many in the face of an uncertain future"-@DrTedros #WHA73
text.155:
"Almost 50 million cases of #COVID19 have now been reported to WHO, and more than 1.2 million people have lost their lives. 

Millions more have died due to disruption of essential health services"-@DrTedros #WHA73
text.156:
"But like any parent or grandparent, that joy was tinged with worry.

I wonder what sort of world Mia will grow up in.

Although she knows nothing about it, the #COVID19 pandemic will shape her life and the world she grows up in"-@DrTedros #WHA73 

https://t.co/PgZC0w11mw
text.157:
"Two weeks ago, I became a grandfather.

As I looked into my granddaughter Mia’s face for the first time and held her tiny hand, I experienced the same joy, wonder, hope, pride and love as any parent or grandparent"-@DrTedros #WHA73  

https://t.co/vqURGtiEt2
text.158:
"I’m sorry we weren’t able to have you in person here in Geneva – but even from the other side of the world, you have lifted our spirits and touched our hearts. Thank you"-@DrTedros #WHA73 #SupportNursesAndMidwives  

https://t.co/NAEt3SsqCb
text.159:
"I have such fond memories of my trip to Tonga and other Pacific nations last year, and I want to assure you of my commitment to small island developing states and the challenges you face"-@DrTedros #WHA73 #SupportNursesAndMidwives  
https://t.co/PbTdWGOhMp
text.160: "I would also like to thank our sisters and brothers from Tonga for their wonderful performance"-@DrTedros #WHA73 #SupportNursesAndMidwives https://t.co/c0791A9DQ3
text.161:
"Your Royal Highness [Princess Muna], thank you for your dedication and service to health and humanity. It is with great pleasure that I bestow on you the Director-General’s award"-@DrTedros #WHA73 #SupportNursesAndMidwives 

https://t.co/2s3yTZs4qZ
text.162:
"In this International Year of the Nurse and the Midwife, we have become even more acutely aware of the incredible contribution that nurses and midwives make, from the first moments of life to the last"-@DrTedros #WHA73 #SupportNursesAndMidwives 

https://t.co/2s3yTZs4qZ
text.163: "First of all, I would like to recognize Her Royal Highness Princess Muna for her tireless support over almost six decades for nurses and midwives"-@DrTedros #WHA73 #SupportNursesAndMidwives https://t.co/9EZ4NBtlFD
